---

The `SHOW-BACKUPS` subcommand displays the backup information for the managed database servers.

**Syntax:**

```text
bart SHOW-BACKUPS [ â€“s { <server_name> | all } ]
  [ -i { <backup_id> | <backup_name> | all } ]
  [ -t ]
```

The following table describes the command options:

| Options                                                                                                | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| `-s { <server_name> \| all }`<br />`--server { <server_name> \| all }`                                 | `<server_name>` is the name of the database server whose backup information is to be displayed.<br />If `all` is specified or if the option is omitted, the backup information for all database servers is displayed with the exception as described by the following note:<br />If `SHOW-BACKUPS` is invoked while the BART `BACKUP` subcommand is in progress, backups affected by the backup process are shown in progress status in the displayed backup information. |
| `-i { <backup_id> \| <backup_name> \| all }`<br />`--backupid { <backup_id> \| <backup_name> \| all }` | `<backup_id>` is a backup identifier and `<backup_name>` is the user-defined alphanumeric name for the backup.<br />If `all` is specified or if the option is omitted, all backup information for the relevant database server is displayed.                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| `-t`<br />`--toggle`                                                                                   | Displays more backup information in a list format. If the option is omitted, the default is a tabular format.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
